experience.description: Project Planning, Coordination and Management

As a Design Associate for Demco Interiors I work on a broad level of library, school, and commercial interiors. I am responsible for designing innovative and engaging library interiors for elementary, high school, university and public spaces while making sure that these spaces meet the staff and users needs. There is work completed in the areas of product selection, custom product design and modifications along with product specification and scheduling. Design work begins with the initial schematics and is seen through to shop drawings and overseeing final installation.

As a Visual Design Merchandiser for American my main responsibilities include selecting new product for the showroom floor from distribution, determining its placement while considering space planning, style of the product, as well as the price point. Once the product is on the sales floor a full vignette is created using an area rug, lamps, artwork, greenery, and accessories to provide a realistic space for the consumer. The main zones that I am responsible for maintaining include; contemporary, value groups, stationary, reclining, leather, high-end, dining, and bedrooms.

While serving, training, and bartending in a fast- paced restaurant there are many skills that have been learned over the past few years. The ones that are used the most with the position are the ability to be able to multi-task, work as a team, and problem solve. I enjoy mentoring and training new team members and while doing so I continue to build my leadership and communication skills.

A large majority of the work that is done in custom framing entails selling while constantly considering what the customers needs are as well as considering sales goals that the company has set. A visually stimulating design with additions to the art work are critical while closing framing sales. Along with design and sales there is also production and shop management work that is necessary to keep the shop running. Much of what led me to be a top seller in the stores I worked in is a personal drive to become better at everything that I do.

As a design intern in a retail setting, I learned a great deal about display set-up on a functioning sales floor and all the work that goes into the furniture vignettes in the gallery. Being able to work with clients on a daily basis was a valuable experience, in-home design consultations and in-home design set-ups were two of the aspects that I really enjoyed in this position. Working with clients and seeing a project come together from the first time they step foot into the gallery until the in-home set up occurs is a very rewarding experience.
